SEARCH
Package gw.cc.financials.check.entity

Interface Check

All Superinterfaces:
MayUseDeprecatedExchangeRates
public interface Check extends MayUseDeprecatedExchangeRates
Check Groups one or more payments together for payment by a single check.

    • coreDelete

      void coreDelete() throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
      Deletes a check and all of its payments and deductions via Check.retire(). For recurring CheckSets, if the primary check becomes null, then resets it to the first check in the recurrence and resets Recurrence.NumChecks if necessary. The method then calls CheckSet.delete().
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - If the current user does not have the required system permission for deleting checks.
      IllegalStateException - If the check does not have a valid status to be deleted.

    • denyCheck

      void denyCheck() throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
      Called when check is denied by downstream system. This action does not require approval.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the check status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTING, TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTED
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException

    • resubmit

      void resubmit() throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
      Called when check is being resubmitted. This action does not require approval.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the check status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_DENIED
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - is the financials version parameter is read-only

    • coreStopCheck

      void coreStopCheck()
      NOTE: To stop a check, call Check.stopCheck(). This should only be called from the implementation of that method. Performs the "core" operations to stop payment on a check. Offsetting reserves are created only if the payment is not a supplement (since supplement payments never affect open reserves in the first place) and either of the following holds: - the payment's exposure is closed (open reserves should always be zero for a closed exposure) - the open reserves for the payment's exposure's costtype is zero Offsetting reserves are included in this check's CheckSet.

      The status of the check and all payments on the check are set to pending stop. The status of any offsetting reserves is set to pending submission.

      If this check belongs to a CheckGroup, then all checks in the group are stopped.

      This action does not require approval.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING, TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED, TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING, TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED

    • coreVoidCheck

      void coreVoidCheck()
      NOTE: To void a check, call Check.voidCheck(). This should only be called from the implementation of that method. Performs the "core" operations to void a check. This method will normally only be called from Check.voidCheck(). Offsetting reserves are created only if the payment is not a supplement (since supplement payments never affect open reserves in the first place) and either of the following holds: - the payment's exposure is closed (open reserves should always be zero for a closed exposure) - the open reserves for the payment's exposure's costtype is zero Offsetting reserves are included in this check's CheckSet.

      The status of the check and all payments on the check are set to pending void. The status of any offsetting reserves is set to submitting.

      If this check belongs to a CheckGroup, then all checks in the group are voided.

      This action does not require approval.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING, TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED, TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED, TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING, TransactionStatus.TC_CLEARED

    • coreStopAndReissue

      void coreStopAndReissue(Check oldCheck)
      NOTE: To stop and reissue a check, call Check.stopAndReissue(entity.Check). This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

      Performs the "core" operations to stop payment on and reissue one Check in a CheckGroup. Each Check in a CheckGroup represents one payee (or set of joint payees)--and therefore one physical check--for a multi-payee "check". The original Check, which is being reissued, is identified by the oldCheck argument, and this (the new Check) becomes its replacement. This check should have been returned by an earlier call to createCheckForReissue(). This method requires that the following criteria are met:

      • The user has the "stop" permission.
      • The original Check is Reissuable and has one of these statuses:
        • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING
        • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED
        • TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED
        • TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING
      The status of the original Check is set to TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGSTOP, and then reissuance proceeds as follows:
      1. If the original Check was the primary Check for the CheckGroup, the new Check becomes the primary Check and the original Check is converted to a secondary Check (still in the same CheckGroup), and all of the Payments and Deductions are moved to the new Check
      2. Regardless of whether the original Check already had a CheckPortion, a new, fixed-amount CheckPortion is created for it so that, in case it was not already defined by a fixed portion, its amount will not fluctuate (e.g., if it previously used a percentage portion)
      3. A CheckRpt is created for the new Check
      4. On the new Check, CheckNumber and IssueDate are cleared, ScheduledSendDate is set to today, and Status is is set to TransactionStatus.TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the allowed statuses or if the check is otherwise not reissuable

    • coreVoidAndReissue

      void coreVoidAndReissue(Check oldCheck)
      NOTE: To void and reissue a check, call Check.voidAndReissue(entity.Check). This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

      Performs the "core" operations to void and reissue one Check in a CheckGroup. Each Check in a CheckGroup represents one payee (or set of joint payees)--and therefore one physical check--for a multi-payee "check". The original Check, which is being reissued, is identified by the oldCheck argument, and this (the new Check) becomes its replacement. This check should have been returned by an earlier call to createCheckForReissue(). This method requires that the following criteria are met:

      • The user has the "void" permission.
      • If the original Check was cleared, the user has the "voidclearedpmt" permission.
      • The original Check is Reissuable and has one of these statuses:
        • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING
        • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED
        • TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED
        • TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING
        • TransactionStatus.TC_CLEARED
      The status of the original Check is set to TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGVOID, and then reissuance proceeds as follows:
      1. If the original Check was the primary Check for the CheckGroup, the new Check becomes the primary Check and the original Check is converted to a secondary Check (still in the same CheckGroup), and all of the Payments and Deductions are moved to the new Check
      2. Regardless of whether the original Check already had a CheckPortion, a new, fixed-amount CheckPortion is created for it so that, in case it was not already defined by a fixed portion, its amount will not fluctuate (e.g., if it previously used a percentage portion)
      3. A CheckRpt is created for the new Check
      4. On the new Check, CheckNumber and IssueDate are cleared, ScheduledSendDate is set to today, and Status is is set to TransactionStatus.TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the allowed statuses or if the check is otherwise not reissuable

    • updateReportableAmountAndDeductions

      void updateReportableAmountAndDeductions() throws com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException
      Updates this check's reportable amount to match the gross amount. Also computes and sets deductions, if any. Any already existing deductions are replaced.
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException

    • computeDeductions

      void computeDeductions() throws com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException
      Invokes any deduction adapters in the system to generate deductions for a check and adds them to the Check. All existing deductions on the Check are replaced.
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException - if the configured deduction adapter fails

    • getGrossAmount

      CurrencyAmount getGrossAmount()
      The gross amount of this check in the transaction currency. The amount is determined by summing the transaction amounts of all payments that belong to this check. Deductions are not accounted for.
      Returns:
      the summed transaction amounts of all this check's payments

    • getGrossClaimAmount

      CurrencyAmount getGrossClaimAmount()
      The gross amount of this check in the claim/default currency. The amount is determined by summing the claim amounts of all payments that belong to this check. Deductions are not accounted for.
      Returns:
      the summed claim amounts of all this check's payments

    • getGrossReservingAmount

      CurrencyAmount getGrossReservingAmount()
      The gross amount of this check in the reserving currency. The amount is determined by summing the reserving amounts of all payments that belong to this check. Deductions are not accounted for.
      Returns:
      the summed reserving amounts of all this check's payments

    • getNetAmount

    • setCurrency

      void setCurrency(Currency currency)

    • getClaimToReportingExchangeRateEntityRate

      BigDecimal getClaimToReportingExchangeRateEntityRate()
      Returns:
      the rate value of the ExchangeRate returned by either the Check's ClaimToReportingExchangeRate if it's using legacy ExchangeRates, or of its ClaimToReportingExchangeRateInUse if it's using FXRates, or null if the appropriate rate entity is null

    • getTransToClaimExchangeRateEntity

    • getTransToClaimExchangeRateInUseEntity

      The ExchangeRate entity for TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount translation used for all Payments on this Check. See getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate() When using deprecated rates in override mode, you may modify the Description and Name.

    • getTransToClaimExchangeRateEntityRate

      BigDecimal getTransToClaimExchangeRateEntityRate()
      The exchange rate in the ExchangeRate entity for TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount translation used for all Payments on this Check. See getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate(). When in override mode, modify this property to change the exchange rate for the Check.

    • setTransToClaimExchangeRateEntityRate

      void setTransToClaimExchangeRateEntityRate(BigDecimal exchangeRate)
      The exchange rate in the ExchangeRate entity for TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount translation used for all Payments on this Check. See getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate() When in override mode, modify this property to change the exchange rate for the Check. This must be a primary check.

    • getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate

      boolean getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate()
      Override the Transaction to Claim amount ExchangeRate for Payments on this Check. If true, getTransToClaimExchangeRateEntity() returns a custom ExchangeRate entity with an editable Rate. If false, it returns the appropriate Market Exchange Rate (which is not editable).

    • setOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate

      void setOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate(boolean value)
      Triggers recalculation of the claim and reporting amounts for the Payments and CheckPortion (if applicable). This must be a primary check.

    • getReservingCurrency

      Currency getReservingCurrency()
      Returns the reserving currency, which is assumed to be shared by all payments on this check.

    • getOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate

      boolean getOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate()
      Returns whether the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate has been overridden for the payments on this check.

    • setOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate

      void setOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate(boolean value)
      Specifies whether the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate shall be overridden for the payments on this check. If changing from false to true, a new manual exchange rate is created. If changing from true to false, the manual exchange rate is discarded and replaced with the current market rate.

    • getTransToReservingExchangeRate

      ExchangeRate getTransToReservingExchangeRate()
      Returns the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate entity, which is assumed to be shared by all payments on this check.

    • getTransToReservingExchangeRateInUse

      TransToReservingExchangeRateInUse getTransToReservingExchangeRateInUse()
      Returns the transaction-to-reserving FXExchange rate entity.

    • setTransToReservingExchangeRate

      void setTransToReservingExchangeRate(ExchangeRate entity)
      Sets the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate entity on all the payments on this check, and recomputes the reserving, claim, and reporting amounts of all the payments and fixed check portions accordingly.

    • setTransToReservingExchangeRateInUse

      void setTransToReservingExchangeRateInUse(TransToReservingExchangeRateInUse entity)
      Sets the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate entity on all the payments on this check, and recomputes the reserving, claim, and reporting amounts of all the payments and fixed check portions accordingly.

    • getTransToReservingExchangeRateRate

      BigDecimal getTransToReservingExchangeRateRate()
      Returns the numeric rate of the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate entity, which is assumed to be shared by all payments on this check.

    • setTransToReservingExchangeRateRate

      void setTransToReservingExchangeRateRate(BigDecimal rate)
      Creates a new manual exchange rate entity with the given numeric rate, sets it as the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate entity on all of the payments on this check, and recomputes the reserving, claim, and reporting amounts of all of the payments and fixed check portions accordingly.

    • isDeletable

      boolean isDeletable()
      Tests whether the check can be deleted. For the check to be deletable it must have one of the following statuses:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_DRAFT
      • TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGAPPROVAL
      • TransactionStatus.TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
      • TransactionStatus.TC_REJECTED
      • TransactionStatus.TC_DENIED
      If the check is part of a group (i.e., the check was created with one or more secondary payees), then every check in the group must be deletable for this check to be deletable.
      Returns:
      true if this check can be deleted, else false

    • isEditable

      boolean isEditable()
      Tests whether this check can be edited. For the check to be editable, it must have one of the following statuses:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_DRAFT
      • TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGAPPROVAL
      • TransactionStatus.TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
      • TransactionStatus.TC_REJECTED
      Returns:
      true if this check can be edited, else false

    • isStoppable

      boolean isStoppable()
      True if a stop payment can be issued against this check. The check status must be one of the following:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING
      • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED
      • TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED
      • TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING
      If this check belongs to a check group, then all others checks in the group must be stoppable or already voided/stopped.
      Returns:
      true if this check can be stopped, else false

    • isVoidable

      boolean isVoidable()
      True if this check is can be voided. The check status must be one of the following:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING
      • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED
      • TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED
      • TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING
      • TransactionStatus.TC_CLEARED
      If this check belongs to a check group, then all others checks in the group must be voidable or already voided/stopped.
      Returns:
      true if this check can be voided, else false

    • isReissueable

      boolean isReissueable()
      Returns whether this check can be reissued; i.e., it belongs to a CheckGroup and either Check.Voidable or Check.Stoppable evaluate to true.
      Returns:
      true if this check can be reissued, else false

    • isVoidableForReissue

      boolean isVoidableForReissue()
      Tests whether this check can be voided and reissued. Note that this is a less strict test than isVoidable(), since it does not verify the status of other checks in the CheckGroup; because the check will be reissued, the payment associated with the CheckGroup will be left unchanged, so no check is necessary.
      Returns:
      true if this check can be voided and reissued, else false

    • isStoppableForReissue

      boolean isStoppableForReissue()
      Tests whether this check can be stopped and reissued. Note that this is a less strict test than isStoppable(), since it does not verify the status of other checks in the CheckGroup; because the check will be reissued, the payment associated with the CheckGroup will be left unchanged, so no check is necessary.
      Returns:
      true if this check can be stopped and reissued, else false

    • isTransferable

      boolean isTransferable()
      Tests whether this check can be transferred to another claim. This check is transferable if the following are true:
      • it is not a recurring check
      • it does not belong to a check group
      • its status is one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING
        • TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED
        • TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING
        • TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED
        • TransactionStatus.TC_CLEARED
      Returns:
      true if this check can be transferred to a new claim, else false

    • isTransferred

      boolean isTransferred()
      Tests whether this check has been transferred to another claim. That is, its status is one of the following:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGTRANSFER
      • TransactionStatus.TC_TRANSFERRED
      Returns:
      true if this check has been transferred, else false

    • isStopped

      boolean isStopped()
      Returns true if the status indicates the check has been stopped. Specifically, if the status is one of the following:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGSTOP
      • TransactionStatus.TC_STOPPED

    • isVoided

      boolean isVoided()
      Returns true if the status indicates the check has been voided. Specifically, if the status is one of the following:
      • TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGVOID
      • TransactionStatus.TC_VOIDED

    • isManualCheck

      boolean isManualCheck()
      Tests whether this check was manually entered.
      Returns:
      true if this is a manually entered check, else false

    • isPrimary

      boolean isPrimary()
      Tests whether this check is the primary check in a check group or if the check does not belong to a check group at all, in which case it is always a primary check.
      Returns:
      true if this is a primary check, as per the description above, else false

    • getSuggestedPayeeType

      ContactRole getSuggestedPayeeType(Contact payee)
      Return the suggested Payee type for the given Payee. Used in UI reflection to pre-fill a suggested Payee type if the user selects a particular Payee. A payee type is a contact role, but is restricted to be one of the roles given by the "payee" type filter. This method checks the given payee is a claim contact. If so it searches through the claim contact's roles for the first one (in typekey order - priority/name) that is allowed by the "payee" type filter. If it finds such a role it returns that. If the contact is not a claim contact or it has no suitable role then this method returns "vendor" if the contact is a vendor and "other" otherwise. If the payee argument is null this method returns null.
      Parameters:
      payee - the payee contact for which to suggest a payee type
      Returns:
      the suggested payee type, or null if no suggestion can be found

    • getAllowedPayeeTypes

      ContactRole[] getAllowedPayeeTypes(Contact payee)
      Get the allowed ContactRole values that can be set for the check's payeetype when the check's payee is the given Contact.
      Parameters:
      payee - The payee for whom to get the allowed types
      Returns:
      the allowed ContactRole values for the check's payeetype given the payee passed in

    • addNewPayee

      CheckPayee addNewPayee()
      Add a new (empty) CheckPayee bean to the Check and return it. Callers must then set the returned checkPayee's PayeeType to a ContactRole and the checkPayee's Payee to a Contact in order for the CheckPayee to be valid. These two properties are required on the CheckPayee.
      Returns:
      The newly created CheckPayee bean, already associated with this check.

    • getFirstPayee

      CheckPayee getFirstPayee()
      Get the first payee on the check (defined as Payees[0]). If no payees exist, then one will be created and added to the array.
      Returns:
      The first CheckPayee on this check, which may be a new bean. Note that this method does not necessarily have a deterministic result, i.e. two calls to this method in different sessions could return different values if the check has more than one payee.

    • addNewPayment

      Payment addNewPayment()
      Adds a new Payment to the Check and returns it. This payment can then be modified as desired to set the Exposure, CostType, CostCategory and lineitems.
      Returns:
      the newly created Payment

    • addNewPayment

      Payment addNewPayment(Exposure exposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory)
      Adds a new Payment to the Check and returns it. The ReserveLine of this new Payment will be set to the provided Exposure, CostType, CostCategory. If the Exposure is NULL, then the new Payment will be a claim-level Payment.
      Parameters:
      exposure - The Exposure for the new Payment - can be NULL, in which case a claim-level payment will be created.
      costType - The CostType for the new Payment - cannot be NULL
      costCategory - The CostCategory for the new Payment - cannot be NULL
      Returns:
      the newly created Payment

    • findOrCreatePayment

      Payment findOrCreatePayment()
      Get a payment on the check. If no payments exist, then one will be created and added to the Payments array.

      Warning: The payment returned can change from one call to the next. Used where the Check is guaranteed to have only one payment, or to edit fields which will immediately be synchronized across all Payments, such as Currency and exchange rate. Use with caution.

      Warning: call this method only on a Primary check. This method throws on a secondary check.

    • getSinglePayment

      Payment getSinglePayment()
      Get the only payment on the check; use where the check is expected to have 1 payment and any other state indicates a programming error. If the check does not have exactly 1 payment, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
      Returns:
      The single payment on the check

    • getVendor

      Contact getVendor()
      If the any of the payees on this check is a Vendor, then returns the first of those payees. If none of the payees is a Vendor, then returns null.
      Returns:
      The vendor, if any, found as a payee for this check.

    • getCheckOrder

      int getCheckOrder()
      Returns the order that a check occurs in a recurrence set based on its send date. If the check is not part of a recurrence set, then returns -1.
      Returns:
      the numeric order of this check in the recurrence, as an int. The ordering is one based, i.e. the earliest dated check in the recurrence will have an order of 1.

    • isScheduledSendDateInFuture

      boolean isScheduledSendDateInFuture()
      True if the scheduled send date of this check is after today.

    • getPrevPaidOrScheduledServicePeriod

      String getPrevPaidOrScheduledServicePeriod()
      Returns the previously paid or scheduled service period of the first exposure that is of a type that can have a service period and has a check whose payee is the same as that of the given check.

    • hasExposureWithServicePeriod

      boolean hasExposureWithServicePeriod()
      Returns true if this check has a service period (as opposed to a single service date.) A check has a service period if it has a WC Lost Wages, PIP, Bodily Injury, or WC Injury exposure.
      Returns:
      true If this check contains a payment with an exposure that has a service period, else false.

    • findClaimant

      Contact findClaimant()
      Returns the claimant that should be associated with this check.

    • coreCreateCheckForReissue

      Check coreCreateCheckForReissue()
      NOTE: To create a check for reissuance, call createCheckForReissue() instead. This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

      Returns a copy of this check for reissuance without all of its fields completely initialized, since it is expected that createCheckForReissue() will finish initializing the object. The new check's status is set to TransactionStatus.TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION. If this is a primary check, the returned check will be a secondary check (since it won't have any payments yet) and when Check.voidAndReissue(entity.Check) or Check.stopAndReissue(entity.Check) is eventually called, the checks will swap roles: the old check will become a secondary check, the new check will become the primary check, and the payments and deductions will be moved to the new check.

      Returns:
      a new Check bean that is a copy of this check for purposes of reissuance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the check is not reissuable (i.e., if Check.Reissuable evaluates to false)

    • createCheckForTransfer

      Check createCheckForTransfer()
      Creates a new check that is a copy of this check. Also copies the payments, deductions, and payees of this check to the new check as new objects.

      Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

      1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
      2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
      3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
      Returns:
      A new Check that is a copy of this check for the purpose of transferring the original check to a new claim.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the bundle of this check is not writeable

    • updateCheckForTransfer

      void updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
      Sets the claim of the payments, checkset, and claimcontacts of this check to the claim given. Also, for every payment:
      • Sets the exposure to the first matching exposure (by PrimaryCoverage and LossParty) on the given claim, if one exists. Otherwise, sets it to null.
      • Sets the ReserveLine to the best matching Reserve Line on the given claim. Otherwise, sets it to null.

      Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

      1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
      2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
      3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
      Parameters:
      newClaim - the claim to which this check is being transferred
      oldCheck - the original check object representing the check that is being transferred
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the original check id null

    • updateCheckForTransfer

      void updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck, Currency targetReservingCurrency)
      Sets the claim of the payments, checkset, and claimcontacts of this check to the claim on this check. Also, for every payment:
      • Sets the exposure to the first matching exposure (by PrimaryCoverage and LossParty) on the given claim, if one exists. Otherwise, sets it to null.
      • Sets the ReserveLine to the best matching Reserve Line on the given claim. Otherwise, sets it to null. The targetReservingCurrency is included in the matching logic.

      Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

      1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
      2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
      3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
      Parameters:
      newClaim - the claim to which this check is being transferred
      oldCheck - the original check object representing the check that is being transferred
      targetReservingCurrency - the Reserving Currency to be used for matching the payment Reserve Lines on the new Claim.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the original check id null

    • prepareForCommitForTransfer

      List<ValidationExecutionResult> prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
      When transfering a Check in Gosu outside the UI, this is the final call to update the old and new Checks, including the updating of Taccounts. Before calling this method, a new ReserveLine on the target claim can be chosen/set for each payment of newCheck. After this method is called, the Payments on the old and new Checks cannot be modified.

      See also {CheckUtil#transferCheck( Check newCheck, Check oldCheck, Location currentLocation )} for use in the UI instead of this method.

      Note that any Final payments on the newCheck will attempt to close their target exposure or claim.

      Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

      1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
      2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
      3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
      Parameters:
      oldCheck - the original check object representing the check that is being transferred
      Returns:
      List of ValidationExecutionResult objects with any validation errors or warnings from the Claim or Exposure Closed Validation rules, resulting from any attempt to close the Exposure or Claim of Final payments.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount or transaction statuses are changed.

    • getTransferredToCheck

      Check getTransferredToCheck()
      The Check that this check was transferred to.
      Returns:
      The onset check on the new claim that is the result of having transferred this check. If this check has not been transferred then this method will return NULL.

    • getTransferredAmount

      CurrencyAmount getTransferredAmount()
      The gross amount of this check before it was transferred.
      Returns:
      A BigDecimal containing the amount of this check before it was transferred (essentially the sum of all payments on the check that have a status of TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGTRANSFER or TransactionStatus.TC_TRANSFERRED).

    • getTransferredAmountComponent

      CurrencyAmountPair getTransferredAmountComponent()
      Gets the transferred amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.
      See getTransferredAmount()

    • isGroupMember

      boolean isGroupMember(boolean acceptSingleMemberGroups)
      Tests whether this check belongs to a CheckGroup (optionally, the number of CheckGroup members is considered as well).
      Parameters:
      acceptSingleMemberGroups - if true, method will return true even if this check is the only member of the CheckGroup, otherwise if false and this check is only member of the group, will return false.
      Returns:
      true if this check is a member of a CheckGroup, accounting for the passed parameter, else false

    • requestCheck

      void requestCheck()
      Escalates the Check's status to Requesting. Which means the following:
      1. Check is moved to "requesting" status
      2. All Payments are moved to "submitting" unless they've already been submitted (I think this the case when a check is transferred?)
      3. Zeroing Reserves are created
      4. If configured to do so, an attempt is made to close the Exposure. If this fails, an activity is created saying the close was not possible and giving the validation errors.
      5. If the Exposure closes and it was the only open exposure, the claim is closed (if configured to close claim after final payment)
      6. Transaction post setup rules are executed on this transaction set because new Reserves may have been created
      7. A reminder activity is created if this check is the penultimate in a recurrence
      Returns without doing anything if the check is not in AWAITINGSUBMISSION state.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the check is not scheduled to be sent today

    • getTransferredCheck

      Check getTransferredCheck()
      If this check was created due to another check being transferred, this method returns the original check for which this is the transfer copy. If this check was not created in response to a transfer, then this method returns NULL.
      Returns:
      the original check that was transferred to produce this check, or NULL if this check is not the result of a transfer.

    • isBulked

      boolean isBulked()
      Tests whether this check is part of a bulk payment (i.e., it's tied to a BulkInvoiceItem).
      Returns:
      true if this is a bulked check, else false

    • getBulkInvoiceNumber

      String getBulkInvoiceNumber()
      Returns the invoice number of the BulkInvoice associated with the BulkInvoiceItem of this Check, or "<none>" if this Check is not bulked.
      Returns:
      BulkInvoice number associated with this Check

    • applyForeignExchangeAdjustment

      void applyForeignExchangeAdjustment(BigDecimal newClaimAmount, BigDecimal newReportingAmount)
      Adjusts this check's claim and/or reporting amounts to the specified values. Such adjustments are intended for cases where better values for the amounts are determined later, after the check is created and escalated. For example, if a check is written from a claim-currency bank account, the amount actually deducted from that account's balance will be determined by exchange rates in effect at the time the check clears. This method allows, for example, the claim amounts of the payments to be adjusted to reflect that amount for which the check actually cleared. Null may be passed for newClaimAmount or newReportingAmount, in which case no adjustment is made to that amount. Adjustments are distributed proportionally among the payment's line items. For example, if the payment has four line items with claim amounts of $40, $20, $10, and $10 (a total of $80), and newClaimAmount is $100, then the claim amounts will be adjused to $50, $25, $12.50, and $12.50. In this example, each claim amount was increased by 25% (equal to the total relative increase), and each new claim amount comprises the same fraction of the total as it did before the adjustment. Adjustments to the claim and reporting amounts are largely independent. When this method is called, the system must be configured in multicurrency mode and the check must:
      • have already been escalated and sent downstream but not been canceled or transferred
      • not be part of a multi-payee (grouped) check
      Foreign exchange adjustments only affect total incurred and total paid calculations. They do not further erode reserves.
      Parameters:
      newClaimAmount - the value to which this check's claim amount should be adjusted; if null, the claim amount is not adjusted
      newReportingAmount - the value to which this check's reporting amount should be adjusted; if null, the reporting amount is not adjusted
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is a conflict between the new, adjusted amounts and the currencies: if newClaimAmount is different from the current transaction amount and the transaction and claim currencies are the same, or if newClaimAmount is different from newReportingAmount and the reporting and claim currencies are the same, or if newReportingAmount is different from the current transaction amount and the reporting and transaction currencies are the same

    • applyForeignExchangeAdjustment

      void applyForeignExchangeAdjustment(BigDecimal newClaimAmount)
      Adjusts this check's claim and/or reporting amounts to the specified values. Such adjustments are intended for cases where better values for the amounts are determined later, after the check is created and escalated. For example, if a check is written from a claim-currency bank account, the amount actually deducted from that account's balance will be determined by exchange rates in effect at the time the check clears. This method allows, for example, the claim amounts of the payments to be adjusted to reflect that amount for which the check actually cleared.Adjustments are distributed proportionally among the payment's line items. For example, if the payment has four line items with claim amounts of $40, $20, $10, and $10 (a total of $80), and newClaimAmount is $100, then the claim amounts will be adjused to $50, $25, $12.50, and $12.50. In this example, each claim amount was increased by 25% (equal to the total relative increase), and each new claim amount comprises the same fraction of the total as it did before the adjustment. In this variant of the method, only a claim amount is specified, and an adjustment to the reporting amount is selected automatically. For example, if the reporting currency equals the transaction currency, then the reporting amount is not adjusted. If the payment's claim is in the reporting currency, then the reporting amount is adjusted to newClaimAmount. Otherwise, the adjusted reporting amount is determined by converting newClaimAmount to the reporting currency using this payment's claim-to-reporting exchange rate. When this method is called, the system must be configured in multicurrency mode and the check must:
      • have already been escalated and sent downstream but not been canceled or transferred
      • not be part of a multi-payee (grouped) check
      Foreign exchange adjustments only affect total incurred and total paid calculations. They do not further erode reserves.
      Parameters:
      newClaimAmount - the adjusted amount for this payment in the claim currency; cannot be null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if claim amount is being adjusted but the transaction currency equals the claim currency

    • canApplyForeignExchangeAdjustment

      boolean canApplyForeignExchangeAdjustment()
      Tests whether a foreign exchange adjustment can be applied to this check. Only checks that have been escalated (i.e., submitted to the downstream system), but not subsequently voided, stopped or transferred can have a foreign exchange adjustment applied to them. Also, foreign exchange adjustments are not allowed for multi-payee checks in version 5.0.x (joint-payee checks are OK) or if the system is not configured for multicurrency mode.
      Returns:
      true if this check can have a foreign exchange adjustment applied to it, else false

    • hasForeignExchangeAdjustment

      boolean hasForeignExchangeAdjustment()
      Tests whether this check has been adjusted due to foreign exchange rate changes.
      Returns:
      true if this payment has a foreign exchange adjustment, else false

    • getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount

      CurrencyAmount getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount()
      Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this check's claim currency amount.
      Returns:
      a BigDecimal containing the amount of the claim currency foreign exchange adjustment

    • getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount

      CurrencyAmount getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount(boolean useOldAmounts)
      Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this check's claim currency amount.
      Parameters:
      useOldAmounts - if true and the foreign exchange adjustment amount was changed, then the prior amount will be returned. If false then the current foreign exchange amount will always be returned.
      Returns:
      a BigDecimal containing the claim currency amount of the foreign exchange adjustment

    • getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount

      CurrencyAmount getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount()
      Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this check's reporting currency amount.
      Returns:
      a BigDecimal containing the amount of the reporting currency foreign exchange adjustment

    • getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount

      CurrencyAmount getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount(boolean useOldAmounts)
      Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this check's reporting currency amount.
      Parameters:
      useOldAmounts - if true and the foreign exchange adjustment amount was changed, then the prior amount will be returned. If false then the current foreign exchange amount will always be returned.
      Returns:
      a BigDecimal containing the reporting currency amount of the foreign exchange adjustment

    • getBusinessCalendarAddress

      Address getBusinessCalendarAddress()
      Primary payee's address if not null, else return the claim's loss location.
      Returns:
      the primary payee's address if not null, else return the claim's loss location

    • updateCheckStatus

      void updateCheckStatus(String checkNumber, Calendar issueDate, TransactionStatus status)
      Updates the status of a check.

      Allowed check status are "issued", "cleared", "voided", and "stopped". The "Issued" and "Cleared" statuses are not legal options if this check is part of a multi-payee check group that has been voided or stopped.

      If the check status is changed to "voided" or "stopped", the status of "pending void" or "pending stop" payments are updated as well.

      checkNumber and issueDate is used when updating the check status to "issued". For other updates, these two fields can be left as NULL.

      Note that if the check is pending stop or pending void and the new status is issued or cleared, the statuses of the check and its payments are updated and a warning activity is created and assigned to the user who attempted to void or stop the check so that the user knows that the check was not voided.

      If the Check is linked to a BulkInvoiceItem (check.Bulked == true), updating the Check status will also update the BulkInvoiceItem status, if appropriate.

      Parameters:
      checkNumber - the checkNumber to update to
      issueDate - the issueDate to updated to
      status - the status to update to

    • getGrossAmountSettableComponent

      IMoney getGrossAmountSettableComponent()
      Gets the Check GrossAmount. Sets the amount of the first Payment of the Check. Should only be edited when there is only one Payment on the Check, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

    • getReportableAmountSettableComponent

      IMoney getReportableAmountSettableComponent()
      The ReportableAmount of the Check. This value is in the Check Currency.

    • setClaimInfo

      void setClaimInfo(ClaimInfo claimInfo)
      Parameters:
      claimInfo -

    • getClaimInfo

      ClaimInfo getClaimInfo()
      Returns:

    • getClaimant

      Contact getClaimant()
      Claimant the check is being written for, as a Contact.

    • setClaimant

      void setClaimant(Contact value)
      Claimant the check is being written for, as a Contact.

    • acknowledgeSubmission

      void acknowledgeSubmission()
      Acknowledges a message that this check is being submitted. Updates the check's status to REQUESTED if it was REQUESTING, or ISSUED if it was NOTIFYING. Updates its payments and their offsetting reserves (if any) to SUBMITTED.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this check is not in REQUESTING or NOTIFYING status

    • acknowledgeTransfer

      void acknowledgeTransfer()
      Acknowledges a message that this check is being transferred. Updates the check's status to TRANSFERRED. Updates its PENDINGTRANSFER payments to TRANSFERRED. For each transferred payment, updates its onset and offset to SUBMITTED. At the end it logs the transfer.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this check is not in PENDINGTRANSFER status

    • addAdditionalPayeeBase

      Check addAdditionalPayeeBase()
      Adds a new additional payee to the check. It copies the base check info from the current check.
      Returns:
      new check for the additional payee

    • addAdditionalPayee

      Check addAdditionalPayee(Contact payee, ContactRole payeeRole, DeductionType deductionType, BigDecimal percentage, BigDecimal fixedAmount)
      Adds a new additional payee to the check. It copies the base check info from the current check first, and then overrides the properties given as parameters.
      Returns:
      new check for the additional payee

    • executeRequiredPaymentEarlyValidation

      void executeRequiredPaymentEarlyValidation()
      Verifies that each payment has a reserve line, a payment type, at least one line item, and that each line item has an amount. If problems are found during this verification, then a UserDisplayableException is thrown containing an appropriate error message.

    • executeRequiredPayeeEarlyValidation

      void executeRequiredPayeeEarlyValidation()
      Validates the check payees for every check in the checkset being edited. Throws a UserDisplayableException with relevant error message if a problem is found.

    • setStatus

      void setStatus(TransactionStatus value)
      Sets the value of the Status field.

    • isPendEscalationForBulk

      Boolean isPendEscalationForBulk()
      Gets the value of the PendEscalationForBulk field. Only escalate as part of a BulkInvoice.

    • cloneCheck

      Check cloneCheck()
      Creates a clone of this check in a new CheckSet. The new check can be modified, but prepareForCommit() must be called on its CheckSet before committing. A check cannot be cloned if it is part of a bulk invoice, is part of a recurrence, has been transferred, or is not a primary check. If this check is the primary check of a CheckGroup, the group is cloned and the new primary check is returned. All deductible line items are removed, so the total amount of the check may be greater than the original.
      Returns:
      clone of this check
